body: T. rex had a ribcage that could expand significantly, suggesting it had large lungs and a potentially high metabolic rate, which supports theories that it was an active predator.
head: The T. rex had one of the strongest bite forces of any terrestrial animal known, capable of exerting up to 12,800 pounds of force, which allowed it to crush bone.
legs: Despite its enormous size, the T. rex's legs were proportionally longer and more muscular than those of many other large theropods, indicating it could move quickly to catch prey or scavenge.
tail: The T. rex's tail was massive and muscular, primarily used as a counterbalance for its large head, which helped it to maintain stability while running.
